intro: Legousia speculum-veneris, commonly known as the Venus' looking-glass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that resemble small mirrors. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, spherical fruit capsules. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
